body.name: ULTIMEA 2.2ch Sound Bars for TV, Peak Power 100W, 2-in-1 Detachable Bluetooth 5.3 Soundbar for TV, 3 EQ Modes, Bass Adjustable for TV Speakers, ARC/Optical/Aux/Wall Mount, Apollo S40 Detachable Series
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 22 hrs 56 mins
features: Versatile and Space-Saving Shape - The soundbar's detachable design allows you to assemble it in a variety of styles to fit the layout and atmosphere of your room. The split design saves space while still enhancing the sound field.

Louder and Richer Sound - Featuring built-in 2 tweeters and woofers, this 2.2ch soundbar for TV reproduces a balanced sound enjoys richer lows, and indulges in crisper highs. Additionally, it has an extra subwoofer interface that allows you to connect an external active subwoofer (subwoofer not included).

Personalized Sound Experience - Elevate your audio with 3 EQ modes designed for music, movies, and games. Ultimea exclusive BassMX technology enriches the low frequencies, enabling adjustable bass for a rumble, pulse-pounding Bass. All of these modes are easily accessible with a touch of a button on the EQ settings.
Fuller and Clearer Sound - The soundbar utilizes an upgraded DSP chip to reduce audio static. This ensures that every word and sound is heard exactly as it was intended.

Seamless Connectivity - The soundbar has wired and wireless dual connection options, including ARC, Optical, AUX, and USB ports (all cables included). Bluetooth 5.3 technology ensures faster speeds and a coverage range of up to 49 feet.
Simplified Control - With CEC synchronization, you can control your TV and soundbar simultaneously under an ARC connection. One-click power/volume switching reduces the need for multiple remotes.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 2.2 Channels In One Detachable Design Soundbar ─ Apollo S40 Detachable Series Your TV craves an audio upgrade to get a cinematic experience! Why not spend a little to get the Apollo S40 soundbar and make a big impact?

Liberty Combinations Detachable, multi-mountable ways, and portable All-in-One soundbar for any combination with TV/PC/Computer/Laptop to suit changing needs and environments. Note: Default Mode: Movie (You can keep the volume you had last time).Briefly the "Music/Game" button for 1 second to switch the Music Mode or Game Mode. Well Tuned Speakers for Crisper Sound With separate dual woofers and two tweeters—work together to deliver clear, wide-ranging sound throughout your room. Treble will increase the ability to make voices, and dialogue more intelligible.Bass will add fullness and increase the sense of presence in films(music, explosions, etc).Reserved extra subwoofer interface for an external separate active subwoofer. The active subwoofer must have a built-in power amplifier(Rated Power>40W)and support a wired RCA connection( Subwoofer Not Included). Space-saving, 2 in 1, Detachable Design The initial state in the box: 2 separated speaker shells. Option 1–Two Tower Speakers: Connect both speaker shells with a base from inside the box.Option 2–A Soundbar: Connect the 2 speaker shells together without using a base. Note: Total 4 speakers inside the 2 speaker shells. Refined to the Finest Detail – 7° Tilt The inventive 7° tilt angle reduces the reflection of soundwaves off any supporting structure and redirects them directly into your ears, allowing for direct immersion access. A Welcome Upgrade for Movie Night Bluetooth 5.3s faster speed and 15m coverage, you can stream your favorite music wirelessly in the apartment/condo/home gym/bedroom.
Detachable Design to Free up Space, 4 Flexible Placement Methods as You Like Previous page Next page
Previous page Next page 1 Enjoy Movie Night 2 Powerful Bass 3 Customized Sound 4 Ultra Fast and Stable

Unlock the Highest Quality ARC Connection First: Connect the soundbar and your TV with the included HDMI cable.Second: Turn on the PCM setting of the TV for crisp sound: TV Settings > Home > Settings> Sound > Digital Audio Output > PCM. (Normally As Below) Note: HDMI IN ports of the TV are not supported. Sight and Sound Unite with a Single Connection Optical Connection First: Connect the soundbar and your TV with the included Optical cable.Second: Turn on the PCM setting of the TV for crisp sound: TV Settings > Home > Settings> Sound > Digital Audio Output > PCM. (Normally As Below) Born with the Newest Bluetooth Version 5.3 Bluetooth Connection 15M stable transmission distance & ultra-low input lag give you zero tearing and stutter-free music, podcasts, and more. How to Solve the Problem of No Sound in Soundbar? PCM Set Up Check all cable connections and make sure that the audio settings on your TV are set as PCM channel.TV Settings > Home > Settings> Sound > Digital Audio Output > PCM. Note: If your TV and Soundbar are already plugged into the AUX cable, please remember to unplug the AUX cable from both devices when switching between other modes. You Can Control Both with Just One Remote CEC Synchronized Control your TV and soundbar simultaneously under an ARC connection( This function only under ARC Mode): Turn on/off the TV and soundbarVolume Up/Down 2 in 1 Detachable Design Two Assembly Ways for you to Choose As a Soundbar: First: Align and merge the two parts. Second: Twist into place. Third: Plug in Stereo RCA to RCA Audio cable(2.5m). As Two Tower Speakers: Detached and stand on base, then plug in Stereo RCA to RCA Audio cable(100mm).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WOW! What a great sound with this bar.
reviews.reviewText: I bought another manufacturer's bar but returned it; the sound wasn't all that, and the volume increments were way too large (i.e. went from zero to ear-splitting with just one level up!). So I sent it back and saw this for only a few $ more.I have to say, wow! This bar is amazing for my thin-voiced 43" den TV! Like many bars, you have the option to twist together to make one long horizontal bar, or put each half on a stand and use as vertical speakers. The packaging was great, and they supply you with a variety of cords (maybe too many?) for your hookup options, including HDML, Digital/Optical, two RCA cables (needed to connect each speaker to the other), and 1-2 more. But that's okay, I can use extras here and there.Setup was pretty easy - I'm using the bar horizontally as one unit, so plug in your preferred sound cable (or Bluetooth if TV-equipped), power cord, put 2 AAA's in the remote, and fire away (you choose your output mode on the remote and it brightly shows up on the bar). No problems connecting. I will say that this is a pretty big and bulky bar compared to others I've used, but the sound is SOOO worth it! It has among the best bass sounds without being muddy of anything I've heard in its price range! It even has a simple bass setting on the remote which slightly tweaks the amount of boom - nothing really wide on the gamut, but a nice little extra. Some people might find it a little off putting that you need a cord to connect the two speakers (extra cords back there, ugh!), but not a big deal for me - they give you 1 very short RCA if connecting the halves as a horizontal bar, and a longer one (looks like about 4') if connecting as separate vertical speakers, so if you need them farther apart you might have to get your own RCA cord (but I don't see many people needing them). Directions are reasonably clear (in about 5 languages naturally).I can't attest to the quality of Bluetooth or wireless because my TV is a simpler one which needs a cable to output sound, but I'd assume it's pretty good. One thing that's a bit of a pain is that I can't yet get my main remote to control the sound (no one likes to play musical chairs with 2-3 remotes!) but I think that's because I'm using optical/digital out right now. I think if I go back and use HDMI/ARC it'll work, so I'll find out.Anyway, this is a big bar with a big sound, and WELL worth the money. Setup simple, seems to get right to business and works, and has almost home theater quality. So far, so very good, thumbs way up!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s awsome for a small room!
reviews.reviewText: We had a small Ruku TV in our bedroom and the sound was okay but not good for anything but cartoons. This inexpensive speaker is excellent, it’s great quality and goes up as loud as you would need in a small space. I would not recommend for a living room.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars The sound is good, but.....
reviews.reviewText: The sound is good, but I have to continually unplug and plug back in the (ARC) hdmi connection into the sound bar to turn back on with my TV. Using ARC, it is suppose to power off and on with the TV remote. It will power on with my TV but no sound until I unplug it and plug it back in either from the ARC connection or power adapter, which is frustrating.

Iniziamo dalla scatola.Trasuda qualità. Imballaggio perfetto.La barra arriva divisa in due. Infatti potete scegliere anche usarla in due pezzi in verticale. Io personalmente ho deciso di unirla per usarla in orizzontale. Collegata tramite cavo hd la tv l’ha subito riconosciuta e boom. Che suono ragazzi, bassi presenti , medi ottimi e i dialoghi dei film sono squillanti. Si può collegare anche con il cavo ottico. In confezione c’è anche un telecomando per impostare il suono in base a tre contenuti diversi. Si possono impostare anche i bassi. Unica pecca è che non ci sono le batterie del telecomando. (Servono 2 ministilo).Sound veramente eccezionale.

La confezione si presenta bene, grande e accurata nei dettagli della descrizione del prodotto.É possibile dividere la barra facendone 2 pezzi, ed é possibile metterle al lato della tv grazie a due supporti con viti (incluse).All'interno della confezione si trovano tutti i cavi necessari per l'installazione ad ogni tipo di tv.Dispone inoltre di un telecomando ( batterie non incluse) che permette di alzare e abbassare il volume, di spegnere ed accendere.I suoni sono chiari e puliti, nonostante non ci sia il subwoofer, i bassi si sentono molto bene.Ha 3 modalità audio tra cui scegliere per le diverse occasioni: cinema, giochi e musica.Per quello che offre, il prezzo è buono e consiglio l'acquisto.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ottima soundbar, completa di tutto, incluso collegamento bluetooth
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Questa Soundbar mi ha davvero colpito positivamente, premetto che non sono esperta, quindi parlo da profana e non me ne intendo troppo, però il suono mi è parso ottimo e inoltre possiede diverse possibilità di collegamento che la rendono un bel prodotto versatile.Intanto vi dico che il volume più alto che potete impostare è 32, che a seconda dell'audio di orgine sarà più o meno alto, ma comunque al massimo è bello potente e soprattutto il suono non risulta per niente distorto. Nel video allegato sono arrivata a 25 e mi sono fermata perché era già tarda serata quindi i vicini potevano non apprezzare, comunque potete avere un'idea dell'audio, tenendo naturalmente conto del fatto che ho girato il video col cellulare, quindi non è il top come qualità.Passando all'aspetto del montaggio, devo dire che è stato molto semplice, anche per me che non me ne intendo: basta collegare il cavo dell'alimentatore nel buchino dove c'é scritto AC della soundbar(non va troppo in fondo, quindi non state a forzarlo inutilmente, come ho fatto io all'inizio)e poi alla corrente, ed i nostri altoparlanti risulteranno accessi con una lucina blu. Dopodiché ho attaccato il cavo RCA in una cassa e nell'altra, controllando che i relativi coloro rosa e bianco corrispondessero, ed il gioco è fatto. C'é di buono che ci sono ben due cavi RCA, uno da 10 cm da utilizzare se agganciate le due casse una all'altra, incastrandole con accortezza e facendone ruotare una come da istruzioni, che allego, oppure un altro da 2.5 metri, ottimale se tenete separati i due altoparlanti.Considerate che avete varie opzioni per collegare i vostri dispositivi a questa soundbar, io ho testato sia il bluetooth che l'hdmi. Il primo l'ho usato per Alexa e per il mio cellulare, ed ha funzionato alla prima su entrambi senza nessuna problematica. Per entrare nella modalità bluetooth vi basta premere il pulsante di accensione su una delle due casse e poi il pulsante accanto con il classico simbolico che si usa per "source", anche per la TV, e questo lo dovete cliccare finché non vi compare sulla soundbar la scritta "bt" che lampeggia. Questo sta a significare che il dispositivo è in modalità associazione e può essere finalmente trovato come "Apollo s40" da qualsiasi prodotto che abbia il collegamento bluetooth. Una volta associato, la scritta bt diventerà fissa e non più lampeggiante.Per quanto riguarda il collegamento hdmi, io ne ho usufruito per la mia TV, considerate che la televisione necessita della presa ARC che è una HDMI, ma dovrete cercare sulla vostra TV proprio questa specifica dicitura e la soundbar in automatico si collegherà ad essa(naturalmente dopo aver collegato l'hdmi anche alla relativa presa sulla soundbar, oltre che alla tv) , quantomeno con la mia televisione ha fatto così.Per vedere il volume vi basta guardare il display di una delle due casse, comparirà il numerino ogni volta che lo abbasserete od alzarete, come potete vedere anche in una delle mie foto.Onestamente l'ho trovato un ottimo prodotto, soprattutto se rapportato al prezzo attuale a cui si trovava nel momento in cui l'ho preso, ovvero meno di 80 euro e quindi ve lo consiglio senza se e senza ma, assegnando 5 stelle.Vi lascio nelle foto anche tutto il manuale di istruzioni, così potete avere maggiori informazioni tecniche e soprattutto più accurate di quello che vi ho detto sopra, visto che come già scritto non sono affatto un'esperta in materia.
Okay, i was thinking it would be hard to hook up, nope! i did it less than 10 minutes. It is perfect for my small living room. It has great speakers. I am impressed n i luv my new speakers.
